name: **PRE-ORDER** Annabel "Youth In Youth" LP
description:
**THIS ITEM IS A PRE-ORDER ITEM.  IT IS EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-JANUARY.  ANY ITEMS YOU ORDER WITH THIS WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL ALL ITEMS ARE IN STOCK.  

IF YOU ARE THINKING THAT THIS WILL GET HERE BY CHRISTMAS, ETC. IT WON'T.  PLEASE DON'T ORDER IT AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT IF THEY WANT THE PRESENT ON TIME**

2012 is coming to a close, but like that late-Oscar entry that sneaks in at the end of the year and sweeps away all the awards, so too will Annabel's Youth In Youth".  This LP is everything we hoped from them and more.  Take their dream-pop and cut it into 11 bite-size pieces.  Add a dash of pep and a tad of reflection, and voila-  Annabel's sophomore LP.  Best served with the chill of fall.

Available in Translucent Blue and Tan.  Comes with download code.

Pressing Info: 

1ST PRESSING: 100 Black/200 Clearwater Blue/200 Translucent Purple
2ND PRESSING: 150 Translucent Blue/350 Tan

Side A:
1. Young American
2. The Age Of Possibilities
3. Anti-Decisions
4. Risk/Reward
5. Theme From "Home"
6. Home

Side B:
7. The Dept. Of Mutual Appreciation
8. At Least For Now
9. Rapids
10. You Could Be Living Better
11. Our Days Were Numbered

name: **PRE-ORDER** Brave Bird "Maybe You, No One Else Worth It LP"
description:
**THIS ITEM IS A PRE-ORDER ITEM.  IT IS EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-JANUARY.  ANY ITEMS YOU ORDER WITH THIS WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL ALL ITEMS ARE IN STOCK.  

IF YOU ARE THINKING THAT THIS WILL GET HERE BY CHRISTMAS, ETC. IT WON'T.  PLEASE DON'T ORDER IT AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT IF THEY WANT THE PRESENT ON TIME**

At last, the debut LP of Ann Arbor's favorite sons.  Mix the best of that turn of the century flavored indie-rock a la Brand New and the slightly newer tapping skills of bands like Minus the Bear with the current emo-style tearing up the house show scene akin to such bands as Algernon Cadwallader and the Reptilian, and voila-  Brave Bird!

These guys are the best at what they do, plain and simple.  10 stunning tracks in hi-fidelity album on one LP to start your 2013 right.

Available on Double Mint or Baby Blue, comes with download code. 

Pressing Info: 

First Pressing: 150 Black/350 Gray
Second Pressing: 190 Double Mint/390 Baby Blue

Track Listing:

1. Too Late Now
2. Scared Enough
3. Healthy
4. Tired Enough
5. Thick Skin (Should I Give In)
6. Whittle Down the Days
7. The Worst Things Happen To Me
8. Get Over What's Right
9. Maybe You, No One Else Worth It
10. I'll See You at the Ring of Fire

name: **PRE-ORDER** Empire! Empire!/Mountains for Clouds/Two Knights/Driving on Citywalks split 7"
description:
**THIS ITEM IS A PRE-ORDER ITEM.  IT IS EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-JANUARY.  ANY ITEMS YOU ORDER WITH THIS WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL ALL ITEMS ARE IN STOCK.  

IF YOU ARE THINKING THAT THIS WILL GET HERE BY CHRISTMAS, ETC. IT WON'T.  PLEASE DON'T ORDER IT AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT IF THEY WANT THE PRESENT ON TIME**

The second installment in the CYLS 4-Way split series.  This split features four new tracks, one per band: Empire! Empire!, Mountains for Clouds, Two Knights, and Driving on City Sidewalks.  

Each band on the split has a new full length or EP due out later this year on Count Your Lucky Stars, so get pumped!

Available on Deep Purple or Hot Pink, comes with Download Code.  

First Pressing:  150 Black/350 Electric Blue
Second Pressing: 172 Deep Purple/372 Hot Pink

Track Listing: 

Side A:
1. Empire! Empire!- Everything Small is Just a Small Version of Something Big
2. Mountains for Clouds- Does it Really Antimatter?

Side B:
3. Two Knights- Solo Swimming
4. Driving on City Sidewalks- For You, Celeste

artists.name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)

name: **PRE-ORDER** Foxing "The Albatross" LP
description:
**THIS ITEM IS A PRE-ORDER ITEM.  IT IS EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-JANUARY.  ANY ITEMS YOU ORDER WITH THIS WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL ALL ITEMS ARE IN STOCK.  

IF YOU ARE THINKING THAT THIS WILL GET HERE BY CHRISTMAS, ETC. IT WON'T.  PLEASE DON'T ORDER IT AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT IF THEY WANT THE PRESENT ON TIME**

St. Louis natives Foxing's debut is that rare album that will define their career and become the benchmark for everything else to come.  The Albatross is scored with trumpets, orchestras, choirs, and keys- every part painting a beautiful and complete landscape that you won't want to ever leave.  Inspired by the classic text of The Rhyme of the Ancient Mariner, it makes a worthy companion piece.

Available on Milky Clear or Dookie Brown Swamp Green A Side/B Side, comes with download code.

Pressing Info:

First Pressing:150 Black/350 Bone
Second Pressing: 185 Milky Clear/385 Dookie Brown Swamp Green A Side/B Side

2. Inuit
3. The Medic
4. Pent up in a Blind
5. Rory 
6.Bit by a Dead Bee Pt. 1
7. Bit by a Dead Bee Pt. 2
8. Den Mother
9. Calm Before
10. Quietus

options.name: Dookie Brown Swamp Green A Side/B Side

name: **PRE-ORDER** I Am the Branch "Only Connect" Cassette Tape
description:
**THIS ITEM IS A PRE-ORDER ITEM.  IT IS EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-DECEMBER.  ANY ITEMS YOU ORDER WITH THIS WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL ALL ITEMS ARE IN STOCK.  

IF YOU ARE THINKING THAT THIS WILL GET HERE BY CHRISTMAS, ETC. WELL, THIS ONE MIGHT, BUT IT'S RISKY.  THIS ONE IS AT YOUR OWN RISK*

I Am the Branch was a band from the early era of Count Your Lucky Stars.  We released their first EP on CD on a small run as our third release.  

We missed out on putting out their excellent full length back when it originally came out in 2010.  It's wonderful and we dropped the ball, so here is our redemption.  Don't be like us, don't drop the ball on I Am the Branch.  Listen to them, they are like a rock band with guitar influences of Owen.  

Listen to it, already: http://countyourluckystars.bandcamp.com/album/only-connect

Available on Blue or Putty Cassette tape, comes with download code.

First Pressing: 100 Blue/100 Putty

Track Listing: 

1. A Chorus About Retreat
2. Bridges
3. Bloomsbury Group
4. American Fox Dog
5. Only Connect
6. According to Our Timeline
7. A Certain Type of Homesick
8. You've Got Red on You
9. After the Fire
10. More Moderation
11. The Waves

description:
**THIS ITEM IS A PRE-ORDER ITEM.  IT IS EXPECTED TO SHIP MID-JANUARY.  ANY ITEMS YOU ORDER WITH THIS WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL ALL ITEMS ARE IN STOCK.  

IF YOU ARE THINKING THAT THIS WILL GET HERE BY CHRISTMAS, ETC. IT WON'T.  PLEASE DON'T ORDER IT AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT IF THEY WANT THE PRESENT ON TIME**

Hailed as a modern emo classic, Joie De Vivre's "Summer Months" is finally available on vinyl!  Not only that, but the audio was remastered and the art was completely redone!  

The CD version is long out of print- get this before it goes too! ;)

name: RANDOM CYLS RELEASE! 7" OR CD! JUST $3!
description:
Try your luck for cheap!  $3 will get you a random CYLS release!  It could be ANY CD or ANY 7"!  Includes Full Length CDs.  How cool is that?  

Please do not request particular cds. This option is for a RANDOM release. Requests defeat the purpose. Thank you!

Limit 2 per order please.

name: SCRATCH 'N DENT! CHEAP!
description:
Come one, come all- We've got bargains and bargains and bargains galore! 

This section of our store is reserved for items that have been shipped damaged, somehow dinged up by carelessness, etc-  like that section in IKEA just past the 50 cent all beef hotdogs and weird berry soda pop.  All of the records are fully playable, but the jacket is dinged a bit or the CD case is damaged, etc.  Maybe a shirt has a stain or wasn't screened properly.  So don't expect these items to look perfect- if you want that, you can find them for sale in the other parts of our store.  Please no e-mails asking about which part of the item is damaged or for pictures, that is why you are paying less.  In most cases, we will try to note what the damage is.    

Check below currently to see what is currently available, and remember to keep checking back as things will come and go.

CURRENTLY IN STOCK:

Football, etc "The Draft" LP- Coke Bottle Clear $11.00- SLIGHT TEAR IN JACKET

options.name: Football, etc. The Draft LP-(Worn Sleeve)

name: 2012 SXSW Showcase Limited Edition Poster- Hand Screened!
description:
The 2012 CYLS SXSW Showcase was an amazing, amazing experience!  At the event, there were a limited amount of hand screened posters designed by the one and only Edgar McHerly, AND THEY WENT FAST.  We held back some because we wanted everyone to get a chance at them.  HERE IS YOUR CHANCE!  Get them before they are gone.  Poster size: 12.5 x19"

Note: This item ships in a separate poster tube because of size and the nature of the poster. We want it to arrive to you unscathed, but it does cost a little more to ship because of this.

name: Antilles/The Juniper Wait split CD
description:
I know this is just a CD, and CDs are getting a little out of vogue, but this is seriously good enough to justify pulling out the ol' discman!

name: American Thunder Band "Neither Here Nor Thayer"
description:
The debut LP that has been a long time coming from the proudest sons of Kansas and worth every second of the wait.  Texas Instruments... No, wait!  Now renamed the American Thunder Band- have carved themselves out a killer sound that almost literally jumps off the vinyl and assaults the ear.  10 tracks with the only 10 names that would match their intensity- all snugly at 45 RPM.  

Catch this band on the road the summer because they are amazing and they will be everywhere.   

Pressing Info: 150 Black, 350 White.  Comes with download code.

Co-release with Texas is Funny Records

1. Spring Break '09 II

3. No Time! Gotta Get to Berbiggles
4. Good Hank
5. Ya'll Virgins?

Side B:

6. Kim Trails
7. Hey Ricky, There's Meafloaf
8. Eazy-E Can Eat a Big Fat Dick
9. Butt World
10. Down to Fuck

The long awaited and mythical 4-way split is finally available!  On this 7", we have the core Count Your Lucky Stars bands that helped jump start our label!  Four amazing tracks that somehow fit on one 7" piece of wax.

name: Annabel "Each and Everyone" CD
description:
Annabel's debut full length. Soars on melody and is big and fuzzy, just like that sweater you always find yourself pulling out of the closet. 11 songs that would make Built To Spill proud

2. People and Places
3. Castles in the Air
4. Bouquet Mines

6. In Droves
7. Adventures...
8. Parade Rest
9. You Started Thinking Again, Didn't You?
10. Widow Party
11. (As Yet) Untold Stories

name: Annabel "Now That We're Alive" Cassette Tape
description:
Annabel has been a band for nearly a decade, started by Ben Hendricks while he was just a tyke in high school.  It went through a change here and there- chiefly, his kid brother joined on drums and their friend Scotty on Thunder Bass.  They wrote some things, and they recorded some things, but this was the first cohesive thing that Annabel became known for.  This gem is what got them signed to Count Your Lucky Stars, and we've wanted to release this little guy for quite sometime.  

Fast forward about 5 years and here we are, finally giving "Now That We're Alive" a proper release, complete with new artwork designed by Annabel's own Andy Hendricks.  If you haven't heard this before, it's a treat.  It's great in it's own right, but also clearly a precursor of all the good things that came after.  Grab it now and see where your favorite band came from!

Available on Black or Yellow, comes with download code. 

Track Listing:
1. Parade Rest
2. Castles In The Air
3. Bouquet Mines
4. …And Elsewhere
5. If the Accident Will

The newest offering from California's folk collective troubadours, the "Rockets EP" offers a more mature and intimate experience.  From mellow horns to subtle strings and somber vocals, Boris Smile continues to explore and expand their soundscape.  For fans of Pedro the Lion, Broken Social Scene, and Matt Pond PA.

name: Certain People I Know "Certain People I Know" CD
description:
Certain People I Know is the latest project fronted by the legendary Bob Nanna.  If you don’t already know this band, perhaps you are familiar with their previous works, which include Braid, Hey Mercedes, The City on Film, and The Bomb.  If bands walked a linear path, this band picks up where Hey Mercedes left off, while still bringing their own unique sound to the table.  The band is rounded out by Damon Atkinson, Jeff Dean, Lauren LoPiccolo, and Matt Schuessler.

Track Listing:

1. Neverlasting
2. Our Lady of Guadalupe
3. Strongsuit
4. All You Gotta Do Is Show
5. NYE
6. King of Shots
7. Rowdy / Pivotal
8. Make It Up
9. How Was The Show? (Politics)

description:
We couldn't be more excited to have these in stock!  

A beautiful piece of art by the talented Ben Sears, this shirt will bring you fame, fortune, pizza, tacos, and whatever else you want- this is, if you happen to be wearing this shirt when those things happen.  And in that case, yes- we will take all the credit.  

Printed on Anvil T-Shirts- brown with blue ink .  So soft, it's like wearing a dream!

name: Dowsing/Parker split 7"
description:
Illinois, rejoice!  You have an entire fleet of amazing bands in your armada, and these are of two of the best.  On Side A, we have two new songs by Dowsing, their second release serving to tide people over until their full length later this year.  On Side B, we find the debut release by Parker, the new band fronted by the vets that led both Joie De Vivre and Warren Franklin. Parker = best new band of 2012.  

Comes with a download code.  

1st Pressing: 100 black / 250 brown / 150 cyan

2. Somerset (Alternate Version)

2. Eleanor Roosevelt

name: Dowsing "I Don't Even Care Anymore" CD
description:
Dowsing are back with their second LP, but don't expect a sophomore slump here.  Here we find a more mature and refined sound- think of it as your cool cousin that is a little older and wiser, but still knows how to party.  Dowsing have added another guitarist that really fills out their sound, and singer/songwriter Erik Czaja is clearly acing his 20s.  10 tracks that are sure to score a 10/10 for this summer.

Track Listing:

1. If I Fall Asleep The Cats Will Find Me
2. Get Weird
3. Where're Here To Basketball
4. Meant To Shred
5. I Don't Even Care Anymore
6. Everything Works Out
7. No Offense To The Fun
8. Ferret Feelings
9. Still Don't Care
10. Nothing To Give

6. Everything Works Out
7. No Offense To The Fun
8. Ferret Feelings
9. Still Don't Care
10. Nothing To Give

First pressing: 150 Black/350 Splatter (Bone with Pink)

Comes with Download code.

name: Dowsing "Retro" Shirt
description:
What's cooler than wearing a shirt from Dowsing?!  How about a shirt that looks like it came straight out out of the 90s?  

YEAH, THAT IS COOLER.  Buy this dud, dude. 

Printed on Anvil shirts!

name: Dowsing "It's Still Pretty Terrible" CD
description:
Dowsing sure has been a busy band.  In the little time since their inception, they have already graced us with an EP and a split 7" with Parker.  Wasting no time, Dowsing has delivered us their debut full length, It's Still Pretty Terrible. Pay no heed to it's tongue-and-cheek title- this album is everything but terrible.  In fact, it's their strongest and most cohesive release to date, and it's nice to see such a promising young group deliver an album that more than lives up to their hype.  Get hyped and get this album!  

Track List:
1. Get Dead!
2. What Did You Ever Do?
3. Gengar! Gengar! Gengar!
4. Wired For Success
5. Lavender
6. Littoral
7. Midwest Living
8. Up to Me
9. Terminals
10. Somerset

name: Dowsing "It's Just Going to Get Worse" Cassette Tape
description:
Dowsing have accomplished a lot in their short career thus far, and nothing makes you realize it more than a 24 song cassette tape.  It's Just Going to Get Worse compiles a lot of demo and rare tracks- this collection has it all.  

Comes with download code, co-release with Keep It Together Records.

Pressing info: 300 white cassette tapes.

name: Dowsing "It's Still Pretty Terrible" LP
description:
NOW IN IT'S SECOND PRESSING!

Dowsing sure has been a busy band.  In the little time since their inception, they have already graced us with an EP and a split 7" with Parker.  Wasting no time, Dowsing has delivered us their debut full length, It's Still Pretty Terrible. Pay no heed to it's tongue-and-cheek title- this album is everything but terrible.  In fact, it's their strongest and most cohesive release to date, and it's nice to see such a promising young group deliver an album that more than lives up to their hype.  Get hyped and get this album!  

Track List:
1. Get Dead!
2. What Did You Ever Do?
3. Gengar! Gengar! Gengar!
4. Wired For Success
5. Lavender
6. Littoral
7. Midwest Living
8. Up to Me
9. Terminals
10. Somerset

Comes with download code.

First Pressing: 150 Black/350 Mustard
Second Pressing: 150 Red/350 Royal Blue

name: Emo Side Project & Little Kingdoms split CD
description:
Split CD featuring three excellent jams that you just have to own.  Two by Emo Side Project, one by Little Kingdoms.  

Track listing:
Emo Side Project- Do a Barrel Roll
Emo Side Project- Ghost Whisperer 
Little Kingdoms- Dinosaurs

name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate) "Airplanes" Button
description: BACK IN STOCK FOR THE FIRST TIME IN EONS! In England, they call buttons "badges", which is silly to me. When I think of badges, I think of Pokemon. Not silly!

artists.name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)

name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)/Arrows split 7"
description:
The split 7" from Australia's Arrows and Michigan's Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate) has been in the pipeline for years, but finally has come to fruition!  

Arrows contributes a long and stunning track on Side A, while Empire! Empire! continue their trend of shorter songs with two excellent jams on the flip-side.  

This record is a co-release with the amazing Hobbledehoy Records out of Australia, so if you are from down under, make sure you order it from there at http://hobbledehoyrecords.com.

Comes with Download Code, available on Silver or Red.

1st Pressing: 250 Bone (Hobbledehoy Exclusive), 250 Swamp Green (CYLS Exclusive)
2nd Pressing: 350 Silver, 150 Red

Track Listing:
Side A:
1. Arrows- All Passwords Are Brisbane
Side B:
1. Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)- Turbo Stasis
2. Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)- We Did Not Need to Open It to Know It Was There

artists.name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)

name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)/Malegoat Split 7"
description:
At long last, another Empire! Empire! split, lol.  But seriously, this split between Empire! Empire! and Malegoat is a real jammer.  

Empire! Empire! tackle side A with two new songs that should tide you over until their next split, lol.  THEY PUT OUT LIKE 100 SPLITS, OK?  SO I THINK WE ARE ENTITLED TO MAKE A FEW JOKES AT THEIR EXPENSE.

Japan's Malegoat dominate Side B with two new songs that are simply incredible.  Think Very Emergency era Promise Ring, but better!  These guys straight up kill it.

This order is for the US Version, which has different colors and alternate artwork than the Stiff Slack one in Japan.  We will getting a handful of the Japanese versions at some point and let you know when we do.

Side A
1. Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate) - When We Did Not Move or Speak, There Was No Proof That We Were There at All
2. Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate) - You Promised You'd Stay Here With Me


Side B
3. Malegoat - Call Down
4. Malegoat - The Midnights Lie Around

Comes with download code!

First Pressing: 
150 Kelly Green, 350 Halloween Orange (US PRESSING)
150 Coke Bottle, 350 Double Mint (JAPAN PRESSING)

artists.name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)

name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)/Rika split 7"
description:
Empire! Empire! embarked on their first European tour back in ought '10 when they met and played a few shows with an amazing band from Austria called Rika.  They became fast friends and pledged to do a split 7" soon after.  The soon after only took 2 years!

The result may have taken 2 years, but we totally feel it was worth the wait.  Empire! Empire! lay down 2 emotionally charged tracks on Side A, while Rika uses literally all the space they can to craft a beautiful track (with a splash of Flugelhorn!) on Side B. 

This record is a co-release with God Damn Records out of Austria, so anyone out that way would do best in ordering it from them at goddamn-records.com.  

Comes with download code, available on Red or Gold.

1st Pressing Info: 200 Black, 300 White with Baby Blue Haze
2nd Pressing Info: 150 Red, 350 Gold

artists.name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate)

name: Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate) "When the Sea Became a Giant" 10" LP
description:
The first release from Empire! Empire!, originally self-released on CD in 2006 and now available for the first time ever on a 10" vinyl.  All 5 songs have been remixed and remastered from the original files and sound better than ever before.  See where the magic began!  

Also includes a rare and until now unreleased bonus track recorded at the same time as When the Sea Became a Giant.

Track Listing- Side A:

1. Our Love Has Made Us Pariahs
2. You Have to Believe That Life is More Than the Sum of its Parts, Kiddo
3. Lilly, I Have Something Important to Tell You

Side B:

4. They Will Throw Us to the Wolves
5. K.O. K.O. (The Most of My Worries Are the Least of Your Concerns)
6. Make Me Young, Make Me Young, Make Me Young, Make Me Young*

* Previously unreleased

Comes with download code.

First Pressing: 150 Black, 350 Tri-Color (Baby Blue +Easter Yellow  + Doublemint).  

Second Pressing: 150 Baby Blue, 350 Beer in Blue

options.name: Tri-Color Baby Blue  Easter Yellow    Doublemint

name: Football, etc. "Audible" CD
description:
Football, etc. returns with their second LP, "Audible".  The songs and the production here are more crisp and more sensational.  The trio, led by crooning lead-vocalist  Lindsay Minton know how to write  a good tune again and again.  Everything is bigger in Texas, and the same holds true for the sophomore album.  Get your Texas-sized expectations up for this because this LP holds more water than a 10-gallon hat.  

Track Listing: 

1. Fair
2. Goal
3. Audible
4. Hut 1
5. Forfeit
6. Extra Point
7. Time Out
8. Black Out
9. Red Zone
10. Turnover
11. Return

description:
Brand new Football, etc. release featuring two heart breaking cuts, just in time to usher in Fall.  Don't miss this one.

This release was a split with our two favorite partners-in-crime, Strictly No Capital Letters and Keep It Together records. UK, order it here if you are across the pond: http://sncl.collective-zine.co.uk/)

For fans of Rainer Maria, Mineral, and Christie Front Drive.  Comes with Digital Download code, in classic Black vinyl.

description: Football, etc.'s debut full length on 12" vinyl, featuring 10 stunning songs spanning a good half hour. Check that, a great half hour. You can hear an album preview here: here Co-release with Strictly No Capital Letters (UK, order it from them here if you are across the pond (http://sncl.collective-zine.co.uk/). name: Football, etc "Geometry" Shirt
description:
Boy oh boy, this is a cool shirt.  It can summon dragons, shoot lightning bolts, fix minor municipal problems in counties of less than 500, etc.  Ok, so it can't do that, but it still does look cool.  AND THAT SHOULD BE GOOD ENOUGH, OK? 

Printed on Anvil shirts!

name: Football, etc./Plaids split 7"
description:
Two future tour mates, Football, etc. and Plaids team up for some serious action on this split 7".  The new Football, etc. should serve to get you excited for their upcoming LP on CYLS, which is beyond amazing.  On the flip side, Plaids kicks out two jams that fall on the right side of punk.  Both bands will be on tour in the UK later this year!

Co-release with strictly no capital letters (UK), so if you are overseas, you might want to order it from them.

Pressing Info: 150 Black 350 White

Side A:
Football, etc.- Down the Field

Side B:
Plaids- Eleven
Plaids- Twelve

name: Foxing "The Albatross" CD + Shirt Package
description:
St. Louis natives Foxing's debut is that rare album that will define their career and become the benchmark for everything else to come.  The Albatross is scored with trumpets, orchestras, choirs, and keys- every part painting a beautiful and complete landscape that you won't want to ever leave.  Inspired by the classic text of The Rhyme of the Ancient Mariner, it makes a worthy companion piece.

Comes with an amazing shirt that screams fashion.

1. Bloodhound
2. Inuit
3. The Medic
4. Pent up in a Blind
5. Rory 
6.Bit by a Dead Bee Pt. 1
7. Bit by a Dead Bee Pt. 2
8. Den Mother
9. Calm Before
10. Quietus

name: Innards "I've Lost Everything" 10"
description:
Witness the full length debut of the Texas warhorse, Innards!  Think hardcore meets shoegaze in a wonderful explosion.  The longest track clocking is at 2:22, but really, it's because each track packs so much punch that we probably couldn't even handle anything longer.  12 tracks in all, fitting snugly on one 10".

Cheeseburger in heaven

name: Joie De Vivre "The North End" CD
description:
Following up on the critically acclaimed "Summer Months", "The North End" picks up the pieces and assembles an even greater masterpiece.  This time around, Joie De Vivre had added horns and keys, assembling 11 tracks that flow effortlessly into each other into one album, yet still stand out on their own.  Expect this one to go down in the history books.

For fans of Mineral, Christie Front Drive, and Pedro the Lion.  

Track Listing:
1. Summer in New London
2. Salt
3. Sundays
4. Upper Deck SanDiego
5. Next Year Will Be Better
6. One in the Same
7. I'll Support That
8. The North End
9. Praise Song
10. We're Equals
11. Autumn in New London

BACK IN PRINT FOR THE FIRST TIME IN A LONG TIME!
Following up on the critically acclaimed "Summer Months", "The North End" picks up the pieces and assembles an even greater masterpiece.  This time around, Joie De Vivre had added horns and keys, assembling 11 tracks that flow effortlessly into each other into one album, yet still stand out on their own.  Expect this one to go down in the history books.

For fans of Mineral, Christie Front Drive, and Pedro the Lion.  

Comes with download code.

name: Joie De Vivre/The Please & Thank Yous/Emo Side Project Split 7"
description:
"All three bands put forth one incredibly solid track. They're diverse enough that they do a good job of keeping the split interesting. I kind of imagine this being one of those records that you pull off of a shelf ten years from now..." 
- Circling the Drain blog

Track Listing: 
1. Joie de Vivre - Annaballin 
2. The Please & Thank Yous - Friends First 
3. Emo Side Project - You Thought You Could Beat Me in a Game of Skip-it. You Were Wrong.

Pressing Info: 500 random color

Distro from Sea of Tranquility Records, Carucage Records, and It's a Trap! Records

Comes with an insert that contains lyrics to each song.

name: Joie De Vivre "We're All Better Than This" CD
description:
The follow up to the North End finds Joie De Vivre more mature, more open, and a little older.  Getting older is something that happens to all of us, but the special thing about We're All Better Than This is that we get to literally hear the growing pains documenting the transition from early twenties to adulthood.  Lead singer Brandon Lutmer is better equipped to deal with "what if's" and mulling over the choices he's made now more than ever.  

A little less horn and a little more rock, We're Better Than This feels good and feels right.  If growing up is a journey and not a destination, this album is your map.

Track Listing:  

1. at least I tried
2. I'd be upset if I broke up with me too
3. I was sixteen ten years ago
4. maybe people do change
5. wait wait wait...how soon IS now?
6. I guess not
7. that dude leads a depressing life
8. going to a going away party
9. who cares
10. Robert Muldoon
11. high school me would have been pumped

Lead singer Brandon Lutmer is better equipped to deal with "what if's" and mulling over the choices he's made now more than ever.

name: Kid Brother Collective "Highway Miles" 2XLP
description:
Kid Brother Collective were a band from 1997-2003 from Flint, Michigan who cut their teeth by playing shows alongside Small Brown Bike, Brandtson, and Benton Falls.  Their final album "Highway Miles" was hugely influential in Michigan- especially in Flint scene, in the days before the rage and influence of the internet.  They electrified and unified the scene- it's fair to say they were the scene here.  But they broke up shortly after this gem of an album was released, and time too quickly forgot how great they were.  Even in the darkest corners of the internet it was hard to find mention of our hometown heroes.  But we have a chance now to give credence to a band that never truly got their shot, despite all the hard work.  Even better, it's on vinyl for the first time as a 2xLP and includes a previously unreleased bonus track and gatefold artwork. 

KBC are reuniting for a few shows to celebrate this release in December, so if you are anywhere in Michigan you have no excuse to not be there.  Details on the show will follow.

Co-released with our good friends at Lower Peninsula Records (http://www.lansingscene.com/lprecords/), available on black.  Comes with download code.

Track listing:
1. Our Last Night
2. Insomnia
3. Prize Fighter	
4. Sore Loser
5. Failure By Design
6. Light Sleeper
7. Too Many Tomorrows (Fair Warning)
8. Ringfinger
9. Breathing In
10. Only If You Wanted Me To
11. Highway Miles
12. Class of 86

name: Kind of Like Spitting "100 Dollar Room" LP
description:
Kind of Like Spitting was on the ground floor, cutting it's teeth and playing shows alongside the likes of Death Cab for Cutie and Braid. Lead by Ben Barnett, they released an astounding twelve albums in seven years. One Hundred Dollar Room is one of the quintessential releases, never before released on vinyl. Singer/songwriter backed by a full band with the most raw "heart on your sleeve" mentality, everyone can relate to what Ben is singing about.

1. Hook 
2. One Bird, One Stone
3. Scene
4. Hoax
5. This Life, So Unlike the Last
6. 26 Is Too Soon
7. B-Side Poetry
8. Yes, You're Busted
9. Free Advice
10. Pick a Town, Find a Box, Live Alone
11. 11:11
12. Sex Ruins Everything
13. Cater
14. Little Time Bomb

name: Kittyhawk "S/T" 12" EP
description:
Here is the first EP from Kittyhawk hailing from Chicago, IL. 

Five songs (one being instrumental) of endearing, hook laden, low-fi emo pop. An excellent first offering from a group of friends keeping their style and sound as personal and honest as possible. Somewhat in the vein of past bands such as The Anniversary, Rainer Maria or Jejune however, the band absolutely achieves a style all their own. A brilliant recording pressed on a one-sided LP.

Past and present members of other Chicago bands such as Dowsing, Into It. Over It., Walrus, Pet Symmetry, Options, Joie De Vivre and more.

TRACKLIST
1. The First One
2. Older / Wiser
3. Science Fiction
4. He Travels In A Suit
5. Partial Paradigm

Distro from Storm Chasers LTD

name: Lindsay Minton "Past is Prelude" Cassette Tape
description:
Solo project from Lindsay Minton, the singer and guitarist from our very own Football, etc. 
 
"Past is Prelude" was recorded in various bedrooms and basements in New Brunswick, New Jersey in the spring of 2008. Features members from Football, etc., Tin Kitchen
 Each Other's Mothers Cheeky, Little Lung, Know Think, and Communipaw.

Available on Black, Gray, and Red.  Comes with Download Code, co-release with strictly no capital letters (UK), so you might want to buy it there if you are across the pond.

1. Snake Owl
2. Joe's Old Hat
3. Spills
4. Loretta Mazzone
5. Heart
6. Home Again
7. Interlude

name: Mountains for Clouds "Maybe It's Already Everywhere" LP
description:
Mountains for Clouds are going to surprise you.  Their first release "Some People Buy Scenery Like This" (available in our store right now!), was a strong instrumental EP with only one song featuring vocals.  They've pulled a total 180 on that train of thought, and now each track is filled with vocal goodness.  An entire LPs worth!  Musically, they have gotten even tighter, which is saying a lot because that was their wheelhouse before.

Available on Black or Splatter (Bone with Purple), comes with download code

Track Listing:

1. I'm Tough, My Whole Body's a Callus
2. Thanks for the Dove
3. Why I Fight Dragons

7. That Night a Forest Grew
8. Sorry I Didn't Realize I Was Already Here

11. This is a Kindness

Mountains for Clouds Debut EP brings us a new fantastic talent, mixing their love of pedals and post-rock with effortless drums and booming bass.  For fans of Explosions in the Sky, Mogwai, and Unwed Sailor.

Own the now classic debute album by emo-pioneers, Penfold.  Now in it's second pressing!  This amazing album changed my musical landscape as a youth, and we are very, very honored to be able to release this on vinyl.  Vinyl includes the bonus track, Microchip.

name: Perfect Future "Irrational, Malleable, Inevitable" 7″
description:
The first release since their stellar LP , Old Wounds (go get that if you haven't yet!) finds Perfect Future ripping out three tunes that will keep you at the edge of your seat.

Co-release with Not Only One Side, Man of 1000 Masks, Sea of Tranquility.

Irrational
Malleable

Side B:
Inevitable

name: Perfect Future "Old Wounds: Warmth in the Winter of 1914-1915" LP
description:
Perfect Future returns with an ambitious sophomore LP that shows the group have really hit their stride.  The musicianship has grown tenfold, finding tighter arrangements and steadier footing.  And that's before mentioning that this release is a concept album based on WW I.  The lyrics read like a documentary mixed with a diary, and do a marvelous job portraying the many ways war is hell.   

Comes with download code, co-release with Adagio 830 & Sea of Tranquility Records, available on Black, Tan, or White

Track Listing: 
1. Prologue: A Sea of Wheat
2. State-Sanctioned Morality
3. How the World Works
4. End Bringer
5. Divine Tragedy
6. On Christmas Eve, the Infantry Sang
7. Men Aren't Moles; Crawl Out of Those Holes
8. Bury The Dead
9. ...Must Come to an End
10. Into the Light

FIRST PRESSING: 100 Black/150 Tan/250 White

description:
Debut LP from Maryland trio on Count Your Lucky Stars/strictly no capital letters. Equal parts sung, equal parts shouted, jumping from extremely beautiful melodies to harsh and frantic bursts of energy, Perfect Future are a volatile machine capable of producing a large spectrum of music. For fans of Far and Koyla.  

Co-release with Strictly No Capital Letters (UK, order it from them here if you are across the pond: http://sncl.collective-zine.co.uk/)

Placeholder (ex-Handguns, Captain of Compliments) originally released this in 2011 on CD with Better Days Records, based out of Olympia WA. Now this impressive debut record gets to see it's proper vinyl treatment.

8. Confess 
9. There Are No Words 
10. Dying For Nothing 
11. Only Ever After

FFO/RIYL: Texas is the Reason, Title Fight, Saves the Day

Distro from Kat Kat Records

name: The Reptilian "Faces" Shirt
description:
You want to look good, right?  Well, my friends, there is no better way to do that than wearing this fantastic shirt.  

END OF STORY.

Printed on Hanes Nano shirts, so soft you could fall into them.

name: The Reptilian "Full Health"10" VINYL
description:
The Reptilian may have lost a guitarist, but what they gained was so much more.  In a massive dose of roaring bass, jangly guitars, and pounding drums, "Full Health" by far exceeds expectations, marking the most intense effort by this Michigan power trio yet.  

Comes with Digital Download code.

Track Listing:
1. Pretty Big Doses
2. Dungeons & Drag Queens
3. Bulls On Patrón
4. Peyote Ugly  
5. Roman Sideburns
6. 200% Sweater
7. Aerosmith Kids

FIRST PRESSING: 500 Black- SOLD OUT
SECOND PRESSING: 350 Grimace Purple/150 Bone

name: The Reptilian "Low Health" CD
description:
At last, the debut full length from The Reptilian.  It's been a long time coming, but trust us when we say it's been worth every second, because these 27 minutes they've given us are blistering and bold statements that all scream The Reptilian are here to stay.


Track Listing:

1. Pan (Sucks)
2. University of The Indian In The Cupboard
3. Chimney Wizard
4. Sam Haircut
5. Thousand Year Lease
6. The Paseo
7. Keif Puck
8. DK Mode
9. Cooler By The Lake
10. Underwater Kiss Makeup

name: The Reptilian "Low Health" LP
description:
At last, the debut full length from The Reptilian.  It's been a long time coming, but trust us when we say it's been worth every second, because these 27 minutes they've given us are blistering and bold statements that all scream The Reptilian are here to stay.

150 on Black, 350 on Beer, comes with download code

5. Thousand Year Lease

Side B:
6. The Paseo

description:
Want to look good while you sound good?  Does that even make sense?  

Either way, this package comes with "Low Health" + a sweet new Reptilian shirt! 

Choose the color vinyl you want and the shirt size below:

name: The Reptilian "Low Health" LP + shirt package!
description:
Want to look good while you sound good?  Does that even make sense?  

Either way, this package comes with "Low Health" + a sweet new Reptilian shirt! 

Choose the color vinyl you want and the shirt size below:

name: The Reptilian "We Have Become + Boys' Life" Cassette Tape
description:
In the early days of The Reptilian, they were four-strong, and Jon would shred on guitar before he moved over to his shredding on bass.  They released two EPs before becoming a three-piece, both of which have been out of print for quite some time.  We've went ahead and fixed that problem by combing them onto one cassette tape for your listening pleasure.  

Side A/Side B:

1. The One Thing I Could Never Stomach About Santa Carla Was All the Damn Vampires
2. I Sure Hope Ving Rhames Isn't in This One
3. Neptune or Mars... or Neptune
4. Let's Slip Away Under Cover of Afternoon in the Biggest Car in the County
5. I'll Ram My Ovopositor Down Your Throat and Lay Eggs in Your Chest But, I'm Not an Alien 04:18
6. So... What Are My Torso Options?
7. Wallkicks Will Work.
8. I Can't Drink This, It's Warm!

150 on Black, 150 on Blue

Available on Black or Blue, comes with download code.

name: Rika "How to Draw a River, Step by Step" LP
description:
"How to Draw a River, Step by Step" is the debut LP from Austria's Rika, though the band has been writing and recording music since 2005.  While the LP is almost a decade in the making, the album is a true masterpiece that few bands will ever achieve in a lifetime of work.  Effectively marrying piano and horns to guitar, bass, drums, and longing vocals, the album is broody, majestic, and open, like a frozen landscape painted by the last dying rays of sun before settling for a long cold night in the dead of winter.  Feeling sad has never felt so right.

Pick up their split with Empire! Empire! (I Was a Lonely Estate) with this while you are at it.

Comes with download code.  Co-release with Goddamn Records (Austria), so if you are on that side of the world, order it here: http://goddamn-records.com/


First Pressing: 200 Black/300 Translucent Green

Track Listing:

1. Restless
2. Port Dover
3. Mute
4. See-Through
5. Safety Points
6. Ultramarine Blue
7. October
8. Retrospect
9. Treasure
10. Departure

name: Snowing "I Could Do Whatever I Wanted If I Wanted." 12"
description:
At long last, we finally can offer up the best album of 2010 or 2011, depending on when you count this baby actually released. Definitely worth the wait!  

Co-released with the always wonderful Square of Opposition records, now on Brown, Clear, and Gray.

1st press (oop): 200 copies on blue vinyl, 200 copies on white vinyl, 200 with screened covers (black vinyl), 100 copies on grey marble w/ screened cover (tour only edition) and 600 copies on black vinyl. 
2nd pressing (oop): 100 coke bottle clear, 100 grey marble trash, 50 red, 50 gold w/ LIMITED (ooooooh) screened cover. 
3rd (oop): 500 on green vinyl. 
4th (oop): 40 pepsi kona, 350 crystal pepsi, 100 lavender, 1 black, and a handful of weird blends. 
5th (oop): 500 clear vinyl 
6th: 300 opaque green vinyl

Track Listing: 

1. I Think We're In Minsk
2. Mark Z. Danielewski
3. Malk It
4. Why Am I Not Going Underwater?
5. You Bring Something... No
6. So I Shotgunned A Beer And Went To Bed
7. It's Just A Party
8. Memo Yeah That's Fine Man
9. KJ Jammin
10. Damp Feathers
11. Could Be Better Forever

options.name: Limited Edition Screened Cover w/ Black

name: Tyler Daniel Bean "Longing" LP
description:
Tyler Daniel Bean sharpened his claws playing with Ghosting. Now he mellows down with his first solo LP output.

Track Listing:

1. Flowers At My Feet 
2. I Think It's Time to Go Back to Our Original Smoothie Plan 
3. Heather Lane 
4. Lake Eola 
5. I'm Just Going to Go Home and Not Make Any Progress 
6. Rootbeerlington 
7. To Give Up Hope At Twenty Years 
8. It's Vegan, Not Vagen II 
9. It's Like Eating At a Vegan Diner 
10. Sometimes the Details Are Underground

FFO/RIYL: Brand New, Pedro the Lion, Desaperecidos

Distro from Kat Kat Records

name: Two Knights "A Lot of Bad Things Happened, But We're Still Here" 10"
description:
Our first release with Two Knights came on the CYLS 4-Way 7" #2 last year, and it was just a taste of things to come.

On "A Lot of Bad Things Happened, But We're Still Here", the two-piece play with their heart on their sleeve, and then tear the shirt off and burn it in seven intense, cathartic moments that keep you glued by your stereo.  You feel every ounce of emotion singer Parker Lawson belts out, every movement he and Miles DeBruin make.  And then you listen- again and again.   

Side A:

1. Devonte's Inferno
2. I'm Your Dad and You're My Dad
3. We are at Max Creed
4. I'm Here for the Pizzah Partie

Side B:

5. D4: What the Puck? (Like if They Made Another Mighty Ducks Movie Except This Time, They're Pissed)
6. A Dime is a Titan
7. It Sucks When You Hate Everyone

name: The Usual "Lady" T-Shirt
description:
A cool, screen-printed tee from some of our good friends in a great Maryland band called The Usual.  You can download their full length for free here!:http://www.mediafire.com/?mflni0n917doen7 

After you love it, buy the T-Shirt!

name: Warren Franklin & the Founding Fathers "Every Letter and Souvenir"
description:
At last, the first offering from a full band version of Warren Franklin.  The gift comes to you in the form of 5 songs, with some classic Franklin jams and some new ones.  All rock, all roll.  

Side A:
You've Never Heard "My Aim ls True'
Every Letter and Souvenir
Let Me Down Easy

Side B:
Some Form of lrony
Bro Downs Know No Bounds

Pressing info: 150 Black, 350 White.  Comes with download code.

name: Warren Franklin "Your Heart Belongs to the Midwest" LP
description:
Hooray!  It's the new Warren Franklin album, "Your Heart Belongs to the Midwest"!  An acoustic masterpiece, featuring songs ranging from upbeat to wistful- this record will wear your needle out long before you tire of it.  Comes with Digital Download.  Pressing of 500 (350 on Blood Red, 150 on Black).  

Track Listing:

Side A:
Bro Downs Know No Bounds
Please Return ''The Thrill Of The Hunt''
Let Me Down Easy
You Get Weary
You've Never Heard ''My Aim Is True''


Side B:
St Peters
Sophomore
Winter Bed
You Rule Lindsay
Your Heart Belongs To The Midwest

name: Youth Pictures of Florence Henderson "Small Changes We Hardly Notice" 10"
description:
The CYLS debut of Norway's greatest Indie band, Youth Pictures of Florence Henderson, "Small Changes We Hardly Notice" is a stunning work that displays master musicianship.  4 songs that span an entire 10" record painting a dreamy atmosphere that will  paint the listener in a world they will never want to leave.

Comes with Download Code, available on Black and Electric Blue.  Co-release with our dear friends over at Siste Sukk Tapes and Records from Norway.  Norwegians, buy it there!

First Pressing: 150 Black/350 Electric Blue 

Track Listing:
1. All I Remember is Punk Rock
2. Hearts & Consequence
3. But Now You Know
4. Swim Team Philosopher
